page.title: 20THE ARCHITECTURE OF BATH
page.content: THE CITY OF BATH IS FAMOUS THROUGHOUT THE WORLD FOR ITS{GEORGIAN {ARCHITECTURE,}WHICH IS VERY BEAUTIFUL AND ORNATE. THE GEORGIAN PERIOD INCORPORATES THE THREE ORDERS OF GREEK ARCHITECTURE, KNOWN AS DORIC, IONIC AND CORINTHIAN. THE{DORIC}ORDER IS THE SIMPLEST IN DESIGN AND VERY PLAIN, WHEREAS THE {IONIC}ORDER IS EASILY DEFINED BY THE SCROLL AT THE TOP OF THE COLUMNS. THE LATER STAGE,{CORINTHIAN,}IS THE MOST ORNATE AND THE OBVIOUS FEATURE OF THE PERIOD IS THE RICHLY CARVED CAPITALS AT THE TOP OF THE COLUMNS. A FINE EXAMPLE OF ALL THREE ARCHITECTURAL ORDERS CAN BE SEEN TODAY AT{THE CIRCUS}IN BATH, WHICH WAS ONCE CALLED THE ROYAL CIRCUS. MY DAD RESTORES THESE SORTS OF BUILDINGS. HE HAS TO SHAPE STONE TO FIT IN WITH THE EXISTING STONE.
